links.title: How to Raise Oil and Stock Prices: Mergers
links.description: The oil industry feels like it did in the late 1990s. That's a good thing, says Goldman Sachs analyst Michele Della Vigna. Oil prices bounced around in the '90s, falling below $10 a barrel in 1998. But oil stocks performed well, largely through consolidation. and Mobil merged in 1999 to form and the shares rose 10%.
